{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3477529,"name":"Raiden Snelson","username":"TheSavageDemon","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thesavagedemon/{size}/243298_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-10T01:55:30.783Z","cooked":"

We have a logic error in which we’re getting an estimated position using MegaTag2 from our limelight. We’re trying to add the estimated position from MegaTag2 to the estimated position from our wheel odometry, but it won’t add together. Attached below is our code. We have tried testing if doRejectUpdate is being unexpectedly set as True, but it’s all been working perfectly. It seems as if the logic error might be in the one line itself and not in our syntax. Does anybody have any solutions or similar problems?

        LimelightHelpers.set_robot_orientation("", self.get_state().pose.rotation().degrees(), 0, 0, 0, 0, 0)
        pose_estimate = LimelightHelpers.get_botpose_estimate_wpiblue_megatag2("")
        doRejectUpdate = False
        if self.pigeon2.get_angular_velocity_z_world().value > 720:
            doRejectUpdate = True
        if pose_estimate.tag_count == 0:
            doRejectUpdate = True
        if not doRejectUpdate:
            self.set_vision_measurement_std_devs((.6, .6, 999999))
            self.add_vision_measurement(pose_estimate.pose, pose_estimate.timestamp_seconds)

The implementation of the set_vision_measurement_std_devs() and add_vision_measurement() are the next place I’d look.

in the quotes as your first parameter whenever you call limelight helpers, you need to add the name of your limelight. For us it is quite literally just limelight
